page.title: 13ROMAN VILLA AT VINYARDS FARM
page.content: Mr Norman of Vinyards farm is living on the site of an old Roman villa. When he was building his house he found a pillar. Roman fireplaces were found behind the modern house. The stones next to the fireplaces have gone a pinky red colour. Wall plaster, still coloured and remains of a meal of wild boar and food from Oxford and many coins have been found. One coin was very small and needed a magnifying glass to see it. The oldest coin was about 215 AD. The villa was built on a slope and had to be terraced. It has three rooms in which one had the fireplace. There is a lot of pottery, eg Gloucester gray and red pottery coloured with clay. There were also the wheels on which the pottery was made. Triangular slates were used for the roof.
